title: CNBC Daily Open: Bank fears overshadowed positive inflation signals
description: Upbeat economic data couldn’t overcome the resistance stocks faced from disappointing corporate performance and persistent banking fears.

title: Meta unveils A.I. 'testing playground' to help advertisers build campaigns
description: Meta introduced several new AI-powered tools and services for advertisers as the company shows how it's putting its mammoth investment in AI to work.

title: Trump files notice of appeal after E. Jean Carroll sex abuse and defamation verdict
description: Donald Trump, who is the front-runner for the 2024 GOP presidential nomination, was accused in a civil lawsuit of sexually assaulting writer E. Jean Carroll.

title: Tech's new business model: 'Do more with less'
description: Technology companies are focused on continuing to drive down costs while reminding Wall Street that they're still investing in AI and cloud infrastructure.

title: Bitcoin falls below $27,000 as U.S. regulatory crackdown pressures crypto's biggest market makers
description: Crypto prices slid on Thursday as investors weighed Jane Street and Jump Crypto's pull back from U.S. trading.

title: Elon Musk says he's stepping down as Twitter CEO, will oversee product
description: Tesla shares rose 2% on the news, as some Tesla investors had worried Musk was growing too distracted with his management of the social media company.

title: U.S. holds 'candid' talks with China amid Russia’s war in Ukraine
description: U.S. officials aim to deter China from providing weapons or other support for Russia during its war in Ukraine.

title: Adidas will sell some leftover Yeezy inventory instead of burning it, CEO says
description: Instead of burning excess Yeezy inventory, Adidas plans to sell some of it and donate the money to charity.

title: WHO says mpox outbreak, the largest in history, no longer global health emergency
description: Mpox started rapidly around the world last year, resulting in more than 87,000 cases and 140 deaths across 111 countries, according to WHO data.

title: CEO coach shares the No. 1 reason you buckle under pressure—and 4 ways highly successful people avoid it
description: CEO coach Chris Mailander says bank failures and corporate fraud cases point to a problem: A lot of people don't know how to approach high-stakes decisions.

title: Alphabet trading at highest since August as Wall Street cheers Google's A.I. plans
description: Analysts seemed pleased that Google's announcements will keep it at the forefront of the AI race and generate returns for the company.

title: Bank of England chief Bailey defends record growth upgrade, admits communication error
description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey on Thursday defended an about-turn in the bank's U.K. growth forecast.

title: Jamie Dimon warns panic will overtake markets as U.S. approaches debt default
description: Dimon joined a host of executives and officials making dire predictions about the consequences of failing to raise or suspend the debt limit.

title: Revolut's CFO leaves the digital bank after two years, citing personal reasons
description: Revolut's Chief Financial Officer Mikko Salovaara is leaving the digital bank after two years, citing personal reasons.

title: CNN town hall shows the network still doesn't know how to handle Donald Trump
description: CNN's choice to add a cheering crowd to Donald Trump's town hall made the event feel more like a rally than a hard-hitting journalistic enterprise.

title: CEO of Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com steps down after just one year as company swings to profit
description: JD.com CEO Xu Lei will be replaced by Sandy Ran Xu, the current chief financial officer of the Chinese e-commerce giant.

title: Why Airbus and others are betting on hydrogen-powered planes instead of electric planes
description: Aircraft are responsible for 2.5% of global CO2 emissions and the problem is growing. Hydrogen could be a solution, drawing interest from Airbus and startups.

title: The Ukraine war is driving a wedge between Moscow and its mercenaries — and the Kremlin knows it
description: Prigozhin's very public criticism of Russia's military leadership this week has made it impossible for the Kremlin to ignore.

title: Bank of England hikes rates by 25 basis points, no longer sees recession
description: The Bank of England on Thursday hiked interest rates by 25 basis points and upgraded its projections for the U.K. economy.

title: Dubai-based airline Emirates logs record profits of $3 billion as passenger numbers surge by 123%
description: Emirates posted a $1.1 billion loss in May 2022, following a $5.5 billion loss in May 2021, as the airline was heavily impacted by the Covid-19 pandemic and soaring fuel prices.

title: German minister calls for maturity on U.S. debt ceiling talks: 'We have to avoid further risks'
description: Time is running out for an agreement, with U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warning earlier this month that without a deal, the largest economy in the world could default by June 1.

title: One dead in incident at Mercedes plant in Germany, police say
description: An incident took place at the Mercedes-Benz Daimler factory in southern Germany on Thursday, resulting in one fatality and one injured, local German police said.

title: Yellen says it should be 'unthinkable' for the U.S. to default on its debt
description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen spoke to reporters ahead of the G-7 finance ministers and central bank governors meetings in Niigata, Japan.

title: SoftBank posts record $32 billion loss at its Vision Fund tech investment arm
description: SoftBank's Vision Fund segment posted a 4.3 trillion Japanese yen ($32 billion) loss for its fiscal year ending Mar. 31.

title: These European countries are pushing to legalize weed — but the EU is not on board
description: Calls to legalize cannabis are mounting in Europe as more countries seek to replicate progressive moves by Canada and parts of the U.S. to greenlight the drug.

title: Covid caused huge shortages in the jobs market. It may be easing — but there's another problem ahead
description: Since the onset of Covid-19, labor shortages have plagued major economies and intensified inflationary pressures, but economists expect this trend to finally abate.

title: Amazon 'not concerned' about wave of unionizing because of competitive pay, benefits, exec says
description: Amazon workers in warehouses in the U.S. and U.K. have pushed to form unions due to complaints over wage rises and working conditions.

title: Consumer prices in China rose 0.1% in April, the slowest rate in two years
description: Economists surveyed by Reuters expected to see consumer prices rise 0.4% from a year ago and remain unchanged from the previous month.

title: Trump urges GOP to let catastrophic debt default happen if Dems don't accept cuts
description: Trump, the leading Republican presidential candidate, said Republicans should let the U.S. default on its debt if Democrats don't budge on spending cuts.

title: Trump pushes false election claims, mocks Carroll sex abuse verdict during CNN town hall
description: The town hall comes one day after a jury found Donald Trump liable for sexual abuse and defamation in a civil case brought by writer E. Jean Carroll.
